intro: Meibomia oblonga, commonly known as the broadleaf meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. Meibomia oblonga is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural research.
